title: Albane­se Announces New Laws To Combat Antisemitism Following Bondi Shooting | 10 News
description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese today announced new laws to combat antisemitism in Australia following Sunday’s terror attack on the Jewish community at Bondi Beach. Albanese said the Attorney-General and Minister for Home Affairs will “develop a package of legislative reforms to crack down on those who spread hate, division and radicalisation.” The changes will include a new aggravated hate speech offence for preachers and leaders who promote violence, increased penalties for hate speech promoting violence, and making hate an aggravating factor in sentencing for online threats and harassment. New powers will also allow the Minister for Home Affairs to cancel or refuse visas for people who spread hate or division in Australia. title: Frontline Workers Return To Bondi Beach Memorial To Pay Tribute | 10 News
description: Frontline workers have paid a special visit to the Bondi Beach memorial, laying flowers and paying their respects to the victims of Sunday’s terror attack.  NSW Ambulance's Dominic Morgan said it has been a challenging few days for everyone.  Today, the community also said goodbye to 87-year-old Holocaust survivor Alex Kleytman, 78-year-old grandfather Tibor Weitzen, 62-year-old brick-throwing hero Reuven Morrison, and the youngest victim, 10-year-old Matilda. title: Two Melbourne Men In Critical Condition After Suspicious House Fire | 10 News
description: Detectives are investigating a possible domestic violence incident that ended with a "massive house fire" and two men fighting for their lives. A home in Melbourne’s south-east was gutted early this morning, while a woman remains in hospital, under police guard. title: Technology Causes More Controversy In The Ashes | 10 News
description: More snicko drama on a sweltering day, two of the Christmas Test, with both nations left bewildered by the under-fire technology. Nathan Lyon made history as Australia made light work of the English batters, in a commanding position to win the Ashes in Adelaide. title: Hero's Message: The International Student Who Helped Bondi Victims
description: In the wake of the terror of the Bondi shooting, we have also seen the best of humanity. Pasha Rahemath was among the strangers who put their lives on the line to help those in danger. The Uber driver from India was picking up a passenger when the attack started. He ran to help carry victims onto surf rescue boards and stretchers and then into ambulances. The father of two told 10 News+ that a man died in his arms and that he helped console multiple injured people. title: Puppy Training Tips For Those Planning To Add To Their Family This Christmas | 10 News+
description: Christmas is next week, and it's a time when many families think about getting a puppy as a gift. Animal welfare organisations generally discourage buying pets as presents and encourage adoption instead. Regardless, training is vital, and to provide tips and tricks, 10 News+ is joined by Amy Smith, founder of Amy’s Puppy Pre-School, along with Yogi, a 12-week-old puppy in training. description: Tonight on 10’s Late News – the latest on the Bondi Beach shooting, the funerals begin for victims of Sundays terror attack, and what we know about the alleged gunmen. title: Aussie Researchers Investigate Links Between Microplastics & Cardiovascular Disease | 10 News+
description: Aussie researchers are leading a world-first study to find out what damage microplastics could be doing to our hearts. The federal government will provide $1.2 million to the Baker Heart and Diabetes Institute to investigate whether plastics contribute to cardiovascular disease.
